DTU Eligibility Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply):
- Suspected GI bleed of moderate risk requiring further observation, GI consult and urgent endoscopy
- Stable vital signs
- No co-morbid medical conditions requiring admission
- Able to mobilize with assistance

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply):
- Significant hematemesis or active bleeding
- Known esophageal varices
- Anticoagulation
- Age greater than 70 years
- Active liver or cardiac disease
Discharge patient as per as per provider specific instructions: ______

In suspected upper GI bleed, patients with Blatchford Score of zero, meeting all of the following criteria may be considered low risk and managed as an outpatient:  
- Urea less than 6.5 mmol/L 
- Hgb of 130 or greater (males) or 120 or greater (females)  
- Systolic BP of 110 mmHg or greater 
- Heart rate less than 100 beats per minute 
- Absence of melena, syncope, liver disease, or heart failure
80 mg, IV, once, first dose: NOW
pantoprazole continuous infusion (0.4 mg/mL) in NS standard
40 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 30 day

Notify provider if hemoglobin drops 10 g/L or greater
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
